glsa.title: Firebird: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in Firebird, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Firebird is an open source relational database that runs on Linux, Windows, and various UNIX systems.

description.p: Cody Pierce from TippingPoint DVLabs has discovered a buffer overflow when processing "connect" requests with an overly large "p_cnct_count" value.

impact.p: An unauthenticated remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to a vulnerable server, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Firebird.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
